intro: Lagenocarpus subaphyllus, commonly known as the small-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and its leaves are typically narrow and hairy. It is well adapted to withstand drought conditions, with deep roots and a low-growing structure. Lagenocarpus subaphyllus plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
